pkgmetadata.longdescription:
raylib is a simple and easy-to-use library to learn videogames programming.
raylib is highly inspired by Borland BGI graphics lib and by XNA framework. Allegro and SDL have also been used as reference. raylib could be useful for prototyping, tools development, graphic applications, embedded systems and education.
NOTE for ADVENTURERS: raylib is a programming library to learn videogames programming; no fancy interface, no visual helpers, no auto-debugging... just coding in the most pure spartan-programmers way.

use.flag: Use media-libs/glfw instead of bundled code
